description: The central plaza of Marineford where the execution platform stands and the main battle of the Summit War takes place. This is the primary battlefield where pirates clash with Marines in an attempt to save Portgas D. Ace.
significance: The main battlefield of the Marineford War, site of countless pivotal confrontations between the world's strongest pirates and the full might of the Marines.
notableFeatures: Execution platform for Portgas D. Ace
Wide open area for large-scale battles

keyEvents.title: Whitebeard Orders to Sink Marine Ships
keyEvents.description: Whitebeard commands his forces to sink the surrounding Marine warships.

description: The bay surrounding Marineford where the Whitebeard Pirates' ships and Marine warships are positioned. Naval combat and ship-to-ship battles take place here during the war.
significance: Strategic naval position that both sides seek to control. Marine ships form a blockade while pirates try to maintain their escape routes.
notableFeatures: Encircling steel walls (can emerge from underwater)

description: The former headquarters of the Marines, a crescent moon-shaped island composed entirely of bricks and steel. Home to the Marine Headquarters building and site of the Summit War.
significance: Former seat of Marine power in Paradise and location of the Summit War of Marineford, one of the most significant battles in One Piece history.
